rev.comment: /* Spartacus */ unnecessary fair use; the image portrays nothing that isn't conveyed by the text, and more clearly at that.
rev.diff:
Line 61: Line 61:
===''Spartacus''===
===''Spartacus''===
{{Main|Spartacus (film)}}
{{Main|Spartacus (film)}}
â
[[Image:Spartacus-douglas-kubrick.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Although Kubrick and Kirk Douglas bonded well while making ''Paths of Glory'' they had a falling out during the filming of ''Spartacus'']]
 
Upon his return to the [[United States]], Kubrick worked for six months on the [[Marlon Brando]] vehicle ''[[One-Eyed Jacks]]'' (1961). Brando eventually fired him and decided to direct the picture himself. The two had clashed over a number of casting decisions.<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=fU78LdDClHUC&pg=PA164&vq=%22We%27ve+gotta+get+rid+of+kubrick%22&source=gbs_search_r&cad=1_1&sig=ACfU3U0VBh2pBtKj3CjazND_pY0DgQzBzw Stanley Kubrick By Vincent Lobrutto - Page 164] ISBN 9780306809064</ref> Kubrick worked on a number of unproduced screenplays<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?q=%22Lunatic+at+Large%2C+which+Kubrick+intended+to+develop+into+a+movie%22&btnG=Search+Books Heartbreak and Vine The Fate of Hardboiled Writers in Hollywood - Page 125] ISBN 9781852426781</ref> until [[Kirk Douglas]] asked him to take over Douglas' epic production ''[[Spartacus (film)|Spartacus]]'' (1960) from [[Anthony Mann]] who had been fired by the studio two weeks into shooting.
Upon his return to the [[United States]], Kubrick worked for six months on the [[Marlon Brando]] vehicle ''[[One-Eyed Jacks]]'' (1961). Brando eventually fired him and decided to direct the picture himself. The two had clashed over a number of casting decisions.<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=fU78LdDClHUC&pg=PA164&vq=%22We%27ve+gotta+get+rid+of+kubrick%22&source=gbs_search_r&cad=1_1&sig=ACfU3U0VBh2pBtKj3CjazND_pY0DgQzBzw Stanley Kubrick By Vincent Lobrutto - Page 164] ISBN 9780306809064</ref> Kubrick worked on a number of unproduced screenplays<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?q=%22Lunatic+at+Large%2C+which+Kubrick+intended+to+develop+into+a+movie%22&btnG=Search+Books Heartbreak and Vine The Fate of Hardboiled Writers in Hollywood - Page 125] ISBN 9781852426781</ref> until [[Kirk Douglas]] asked him to take over Douglas' epic production ''[[Spartacus (film)|Spartacus]]'' (1960) from [[Anthony Mann]] who had been fired by the studio two weeks into shooting.
